state.summary: On search page with search input field and search button visible

result: failure: Element is not an <input>, <textarea>, <select> or [contenteditable]. Element is a button, not an input field.
reflection: CRITICAL RULE: You can ONLY use fill() on elements with role='textbox', role='input', type='text', or type='textarea' - NEVER on elements with role='button' or type='button'. Before using fill(), ALWAYS check the accessibility tree to find the element with role='textbox' (the input field), not the element with role='button' (the search button). Buttons are for clicking only, textboxes are for typing.

state.summary: On search page, need to identify which element can accept text input

result: failure: Cannot fill button elements. Only textbox, input, textarea, or contenteditable elements accept text input.
reflection: GENERAL RULE: Buttons (role=button, type=button) are for clicking ONLY - you CANNOT type text into them. Input fields (role=textbox, type=text, or element type=input/textarea) are for entering text. When you need to type text, you MUST find the element with role='textbox' in the accessibility tree - look for the word 'textbox' in the element description. Do NOT use the button element for typing.

action: fill and click together in one step
result: failure: Received a multi-action, only single-actions are allowed.
reflection: CRITICAL: The system only allows ONE action per step. You cannot execute fill() and click() together. You must first execute fill() on the textbox element (with role=textbox), wait for it to complete, then in the NEXT step execute click() on the button element separately.
